intro: Trichipteris arbuscula, commonly known as the small tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk and a crown of long, pinnate fronds. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments, typically in forest understories. Its rhizome is thick and woody, supporting the growth of the trunk and roots. Trichipteris arbuscula plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various organisms.
